results.title: The Kite
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Ami Chew
results.brief_description: A fascinating animated work which uses string and buttons and other materials to create a sympathetic and likable character whose dream is to free a kite caught up in a tree on the top of a hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Ami Chew

results.title: Jettison
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose
results.brief_description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose
results.description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival

results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Eddie Wong

results.title: Fish
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Hafiz Zamri
results.brief_description: An allegorical tale of struggle and survival in a competitive world. Filmed in black and white this rather tragic story contains some disturbing scenes. Uses hand-drawn animation, music soundtrack and no commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Hafiz Zamri
results.description: An allegorical tale of struggle and survival in a competitive world. Filmed in black and white this rather tragic story contains some disturbing scenes. Uses hand-drawn animation, music soundtrack and no commentary.

results.title: Cinco anos
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Angela Barnett
results.brief_description: Accompanied by a soundtrack of vibrant Spanish music, this animated short contains a montage of multi-layered colourful images using hand-drawn animation, newspaper cuttings and stills to convey a sense of location and environment.

results.title: Bonely angel
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Patsarun Chuthapisit
results.brief_description: This macabre “fractured fairytale” of a lost and lonely angel is most entertaining with its twisted sense of humour and storybook presentation. Uses hand-drawn animation and beautiful pastel colours.
